description: From French couplet, from couple + -et. Doublet of cabaletta.

definitionGroups.group: A set of two things, particularly

entries.meaning: (literature) A pair of lines, typically with rhyming end words.
examples: Coordinate terms: tercet, quatrain, cinquain, sestet, septet, octave

entries.meaning: A pair of one-way streets which carry opposing directions of traffic through gridded urban areas.
examples: 5th Street is one-way west only and 6th Street is one-way east only. Together, they form a couplet in Downtown Los Angeles.

entries.meaning: (taxonomy) A pair of two mutually exclusive choices in a dichotomous key.
